instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V35_S3: What is PP1V35_S3? PP1V35_S3 is a 1.35v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PPVTTDDR_S3: What is PPVTTDDR_S3? PPVTTDDR_S3 is a 3.3v power rail that powers the DDR RAM when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state. .
definitions.PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS: What is PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS? PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor to components that create power rails for the GPU. .
definitions.PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER5V_ISNS: What is PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER5V_ISNS? PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER5V_ISNS IS PPBUS_G3H voltage after it has passed through a current sense resistor that supplies the TPS51980 and its associated buck converter with voltage to create the PP5V_S4 power rail..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not posting ...
threads.message:
My first post , Hi to all you nice people :)
please bare with me I am a total newbie at this . I tried to find similar posts to find a solution but couldnt .
I have 4 boards with exactly the same problem , at least the symptoms are exactly the same .
No liquid damage and no corrosion whatsoever. They all start and come up to 1.5A and after 3 seconds drop down to 0v and that repeats all the time . I am guessing you all will say the cpu is dead but still maybe someone have some other idea ?  The boards are three 3787 and one 3662. They all have fanspin and green and orange light. They have no chime and with a usb mouse plugged in it briefly flashes and turnes off in the same pace as the boards go down to 0v. Please tell what measurements you need to make a diagnose or point me in the right direction . All if any help is highly apreciated . Thanks in advance . here are some measurements I made so far
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 16   -  18.12 V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  -    12.58 V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER5V_ISNS</SIGNAL>   -   12.57 V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER3V3_ISNS</SIGNAL>  -  12.56 V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL>   -   12.57 V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>   -   12.57V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>   -    5.64 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>   -  3.33 V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> - 5.0 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - 5.0V
<SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3</SIGNAL>  - 1.34 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> - 3.33 V
<SIGNAL>PPVTTDDR_S3</SIGNAL>  - 0.68 V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>  - 1.05V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>   -  1.79V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PP1V0_S0GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL> 0 V
PP1V5R1V35_S0GPU  -  1.5 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> - 3.3 V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not posting ...
threads.message:
Welcome to the forum!

All these boards have FDMF6808N as common issue.
You should start changing all 3 chips with real new FDMF6708N bought from serious store, like mouser.
Do not buy "new" FDMF6808N from chinese stores, all are refurbished!

"<SIGNAL>PP1V0_S0GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL> 0 V"
Are you sure no volt at all at L8710?
Post <CHIP>U8710</CHIP> voltages.
This is valid for 3787 board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not posting ...
threads.message:
Thank you soooo much 2informaticos , you are an angel.
The L8710 has 1.05 V on both sides 
The values for the <CHIP>U8710</CHIP> does not seem right though , here they are :
1. 0 V                                  9.  3.3 V
2. 0 V                                10. 1.08 V
3. 3.3 V                             11. 2.12 V                                                                  
4. 0.5 V                             12. 5.6 V
5. 2.2 V                             13. 5.05 V
6. 0.5 V                             14. 5.06 V
7. 1.03 V                           15. 4.52 V
8. 1.05 V                           16 GND

I usually buy from digi key and I will order as soon as they open this morning , its 4.30 am over here now :) I will order FDMF6708N at least 30 pieces eventhough some may think its no idea to replace them :)
I like positive people so lets take a chance and still replace them .... if the CPU is dead its dead but at least I know I have tried . Thank you again 2informaticos

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not posting ...
threads.message:
Forget about <CHIP>U8710</CHIP>, if you get 1V at L8710.
I asked about it because you missed that voltage on the first post...
